thread.title: Police: Woman crashes trying to drive through funeral procession in Oak Park - Oak Leaves
thread.title_full: Police: Woman crashes trying to drive through funeral procession in Oak Park - Oak Leaves

author: Steve Schering
title: Police: Woman crashes trying to drive through funeral procession in Oak Park - Oak Leaves
text:
A woman tried to drive through a funeral procession in Oak Park Monday, causing a two-car accident sent three people to the hospital, police said.
According to Oak Park police, the procession was headed southbound on Ridgeland Avenue shortly after noon when the 48-year-old woman, who was heading westbound on Augusta Street, drove through the intersection as the procession was moving through.
The woman, a Chicago resident, collided with one car in the procession, with both vehicles ending up on the sidewalk near the intersection, police said.
According to Oak Park police Cmdr. LaDon Reynolds, the two people inside the procession car were taken to West Suburban Hospital with minor injuries.
Reynolds said the offender was taken to Loyola University Medical Center with minor injuries.
The offender was cited for failure to yield and damage to village property, police said.
